name: Physical symptoms and exam results requiring referral
title: ANC.DT.06 Physical symptoms and exam results requiring referral
description: If the woman has any of the following physical exam results, refer to the hospital

action.title: ANC.DT.06 Physical symptoms and exam results requiring referral
Conduct further investigation and, if necessary, refer urgently if treatment not available at your facility
action.textEquivalent:
Woman has a fever – provide treatment and refer urgently to hospital!
Procedure:
– Insert an IV line
– Give fluids slowly

documentation.label: Managing complications guide (IMPAC) (2017): Section S-113 (5)

action.title: Refer to a hospital
action.textEquivalent:
Abnormal pulse rate – refer for further investigation
Procedure:
– Check for fever, infection, respiratory distress, arrhythmia
– Refer for further investigation

documentation.label: Managing complications guide (IMPAC) (2017): Section S-1 (5)

action.title: Refer urgently to a hospital
action.textEquivalent: Woman has respiratory distress – refer urgently to the hospital!

documentation.label: Managing complications in pregnancy and childbirth guide (IMPAC) (2017): Section S-149 (5)

action.title: Refer urgently to a hospital
action.textEquivalent: Woman should be referred urgently if there is evidence of amniotic fluid, which could indicate the start of labour

documentation.label: Managing complications in pregnancy and childbirth guide (IMPAC) (2017): Sections S-51, C-91 (5)

expression.description:
("Pelvic exam result (visual)" = "Evidence of amniotic fluid")
  AND ("Gestational age" < 37 weeks)

action.title: Refer to a hospital
action.textEquivalent:
If no fetal heartbeat is observed, inform the woman that there might be a problem and that she needs to be referred to the hospital for further examination and next steps.

Procedure:
– Inform the woman that you cannot find the heartbeat and need to refer her to check if there's a problem
– Refer to hospital

documentation.label: Pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and newborn care guide (IMPAC) (2015): C7 (1)

expression.description:
("Fetal heartbeat present" = FALSE)
  AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 20 weeks)

action.title: Refer to a hospital
action.textEquivalent: Fetal heart rate is abnormal after two readings: the woman should be referred to hospital

documentation.label: Pregnancy, childbirth, postpartum and newborn care guide (IMPAC) (2015): C7 (1)

expression.description:
(100 bpm > "Second fetal heart rate" > 180 bpm)
  AND ("Gestational age" ≥ 20 weeks)
